dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hey. Thanks for coming.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I wish I'd had more time to prepare a proper analysis on the costs and benefits of your proposed union, but I suppose we'll have to... improvise.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's the spirit.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sanjar, you have got to scale it back.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't have time for nonsense from either of you, so let's just get this done.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Gotta admit... I really thought I was walking into a trap here. I'm ready.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Sanjar. Stellar Bay's got food and walls, and my people need both. If you'll have us, we're willing to share the space.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Do you have any idea what that would cost? Why, drawing up the budget alone is going to take weeks.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You don't have weeks, Sanjar. Zora's ready to storm the city right now.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What if the Iconoclasts just supported your supply lines?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If you're going to draw up a budget, I'd appreciate a paycheck.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Though I admit I'd rather not. We've shed enough blood as it is.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Is the only choice here between fighting and starving? We've got to be practical.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Come on, Sanjar, you can't start negotiations this way.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So negative. No wonder the other execs didn't like you.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: This feels more like an assault than a negotiation.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm getting a bit of deja vu, Captain.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: You did a strange thing with your eyes just now. Is this all supposed to mean something to me?

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Come on. You can't be this obtuse. Tell me Graham wasn't working alone. He couldn't have.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Careful, Zora. Graham was Sanjar's friend.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Something tells me Sanjar didn't know.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't think Sanjar would have hurt anyone. If he knew, he didn't agree to it.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: His fr - HIS friend? Are you fucking kidding me, Captain? I've been standing with Graham for the better part of a decade while this paperclip cowboy sat behind his walls!

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: This feels like one of those times when everyone at headquarters but me is laughing at something. But you two aren't laughing.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Amber Heights, you hullhead! Ten years ago! Graham had all those people killed!

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: What? That's not possible. Even for him, that's going too far.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: It is. We found correspondences between him and the pirates.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Wasn't it convenient how they all died just after blocking your proposal?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're missing the big picture for the details again.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: But... that means...

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I had no idea, I swear. We were both fed up with corporate leadership, but I never guessed he'd do something like that.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: And I'm supposed to believe that?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Take it back a notch, Zora. You're here for your people, not the past.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sanjar, you're a leader. That means taking responsibility.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Is this going to take much longer? I have places to be.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: You're right. Live in the moment.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: At this moment, I need a place for my people. You can share or we can take it. Up to you.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: This shall be good practice for working with the Board, I see. Still, anything's cheaper than war. You have a deal, Zora.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What about the targeting module?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Guess that's that.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: If we're in Stellar Bay, then we don't need it yet. I just need a promise that when we do, we'll share it.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Thank you for brokering this arrangement.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Yeah. Here's hoping we don't come to regret this.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Thanks for coming out, Sanjar. I, uh... guess I'll see you at Stellar Bay.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: For what? Graham was a rabid canid. He may have fooled me, but I wasn't the only one.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: It... you know, forget it. Look, my people need a place to live. You can give it to us or we can take it. Your choice.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: You know, I don't think you're taking this seriously.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Fine, I'll speed this up for our impatient captain here. My people need a place to live and we're prepared to take it from you unless you want to share.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I certainly didn't think so at the time, but now that you mention it...

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I... by the void, that's just what Celia would say.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Void take his agreement. He stood by and let it happen.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Now, there's no cause for rudeness.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Rude would be slaughtering you while you're asleep in your home. Isn't that what we do to executive types?

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Not good enough. I need to move a fair amount of my people into the city. We need shelter, Captain.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm not saying live outside - just help out in the wilderness once in a while.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Being stubborn about this isn't going to get you anywhere.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: At least that'd be better than nothing.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm sure you can find a way to make it work.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Suppose some of our healthier folk could offer aid. Some of us need to stay in the city proper, though.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Truly, a compromise? I'm not sure I'd ever have heard as much from Graham.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Graham was a murderous fiend, and I'd be shocked if you didn't already know that.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Fine. Some of our people can help with supply lines. But I have to ask for some room in the city itself.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: We aren't here for "better than nothing," Captain!

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: If not for the professional courtesy I owe our friend here, we wouldn't even be talking about this.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: You said that with a very ominous tone just now. Was that intentional?

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Graham was fit to just eke by on our will to survive. That "make it work" mentality got a lot of good people killed. No more.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Come now, this is no time for one of your jokes.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hey, if we're taking over the company, I'm sure there're a lot of old life insurance policies to cash in.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm confused. The look on your face does not match the words you just said.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: This is very hard for me.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I certainly hope you don't mean to undercut the value of due diligence.
